author: Special Correspondent
text:
Decide your goal early, the officer advises youth

U. Sagayam, Vice-Chairman, Science City, giving away certificate to gold medal-winner Justina Princy at the Holy Cross College day celebration in Tiruchi on Saturday.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

College students should utilise the opportunities available in the present-day scenario to emerge successful in the career, said U. Sagayam, Vice-Chairman, Science City.

Addressing students of Holy Cross College on the occasion of its 93-rd annual day celebrations here on Saturday, Mr. Sagayam said students should set their goals well during their educational career. He specifically advised them to prepare for the competitive test conducted by the Union Public Service Commission.

He said students should make use of the opportunities for acing the competitive examinations. He said the study material was now available much more easily than in the past.

Mr. Sagayam repeatedly stressed the role of government school teachers particularly in rural areas in shaping the character of the students. “It is these rural teachers who properly guide these pupils hailing from economically poor families,” he said. He was explaining his experience in various government schools in Namakkal and Madurai during his tenure as District Collector.

Mr. Sagayam advised students to take maximum use of libraries. “Be not complacent with your academic achievement and develop the habit of reading books in addition to your academic syllabus,” he said.
title: Clear UPSC test, Sagayam asks students
